  MARQUEE = 3, END_SMALL = 4

Detailed Description

Displays text to the user and optionally allows them to edit it.

A TextWidget is a complete text editor, however the basic class is configured to not allow editing; see EditWidget for a subclass that configures the text widget for editing.

Please see the following example for simple usage of TextWidget.

 void MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState) {
   myTextWidget = new gaia::ui::TextWidget(static_cast<Page*>(this));
   myTextWidget->setText("Hello, World!");
   // you should delete myTextWidget somewhere
 }

Definition at line 66 of file TextWidget.h.

enum gaia::ui::TextWidget::EllipsizeTruncateAt

Used to define where to set ellipsize.

The default is NONE.

MIDDLE 
END 
MARQUEE 
END_SMALL

const gaia::graphics::Rect *  bounds

Parameters:
linewhich line to examine (0..getLineCount() - 1)
boundsOptional. If not NULL, it returns the extent of the line
Returns:
the Y-coordinate of the baseline

int32_t gaia::ui::TextWidget::getLineHeight ( )

Returns the height of one standard line in pixels.

Remarks:
Note that markup within the text can cause individual lines to be taller or shorter than this height, and the layout may contain additional first- or last-line padding.

The default is true.

void gaia::ui::TextWidget::setHeight ( int32_t  height)

Makes the TextWidget be exactly this many pixels tall.

You could get the same effect by specifying this number in the ControllerParams.

Remarks:
Sets this value overrides any other (minimum / maximum) number of lines or height setting.

void gaia::ui::TextWidget::setHint ( const gaia::base::CharSequence *  text)

Sets the text to be displayed when the text of the TextWidget is empty.

NULL means to use the normal empty text. The hint does not currently participate in determining the size of the view.

gaia::service::EditorInfo::_EditorInfo
void gaia::ui::TextWidget::setIncludeFontPadding ( bool  includepad)

Set whether the TextWidget includes extra top and bottom padding to make room for accents that go above the normal ascent and descent.

The default is true.

See also:
getIncludeFontPadding()
void gaia::ui::TextWidget::setInputType ( int32_t  type)

Set the type of the content with a constant as defined for gaia::text::InputType.

This will take care of changing the key listener, by calling setKeyListener(const gaia::text::KeyListener*), to match the given content type. If the given content type is gaia::text::InputType::TYPE_NULL then a soft keyboard will not be displayed for this text widget.

Remarks:
the maximum number of displayed lines (see setMaxLines(int32_t)) will be modified if you change the gaia::text::InputType::TYPE_TEXT_FLAG_MULTI_LINE flag of the input type.
void gaia::ui::TextWidget::setKeyListener ( const gaia::text::KeyListener *  listener)

Sets the key listener to be used with this TextWidget.

void gaia::ui::TextWidget::setLines ( int32_t  lines)

Makes the TextWidget exactly this many lines tall.

Remarks:
Sets this value overrides any other (minimum / maximum) number of lines or height setting. A single line TextWidget will set this value to 1.
void gaia::ui::TextWidget::setLineSpacing ( float  add,
float  mult 
)

Sets line spacing for this TextWidget.

Remarks:
Each line will have its height multiplied by mult and have add added to it.
void gaia::ui::TextWidget::setLinksClickable ( bool  whether)

Sets whether the movement method will automatically be set to gaia::text::LinkMovementMethod if setAutoLinkMask has been set to nonzero and links are detected in setText.

The default is true.

void gaia::ui::TextWidget::setLinkTextColor ( int32_t  color)

Sets the color of links in the text.

void gaia::ui::TextWidget::setMarqueeRepeatLimit ( int32_t  marqueeLimit)

Sets how many times to repeat the marquee animation.

Parameters:
marqueeSet to -1 to repeat indefinitely.
Remarks:
Only applied if the TextWidget has marquee enabled.

Makes the TextWidget at most this many pixels tall.

This option is mutually exclusive with the setMaxLines(int32_t) method.

void gaia::ui::TextWidget::setMovementMethod ( const gaia::text::MovementMethod *  movement)

Sets the movement method (arrow key handler) to be used for this TextWidget.

Parameters:
movementThis can be NULL to disallow using the arrow keys to move the cursor or scroll the view.
Remarks:
Be warned that if you want a TextWidget with a key listener or movement method not to be focusable, or if you want a TextWidget without a key listener or movement method to be focusable, you must call setFocusable again after calling this to get the focusability back the way you want it.
void gaia::ui::TextWidget::setSelectAllOnFocus ( bool  selectAllOnFocus)

Set the TextWidget so that when it takes focus, all the text is selected.

float  dx,
float  dy,
int32_t  color 
)

Gives the text a shadow of the specified radius and color, the specified distance from its normal position.

void gaia::ui::TextWidget::setShowSoftInputOnFocus ( bool  show)

Sets whether the soft input method will be made visible when this TextWidget gets focused.

Remarks:
The default is true.
void gaia::ui::TextWidget::setSingleLine ( bool  singleLine)

If true, sets the properties of this field (number of lines, horizontally scrolling, transformation method) to be for a single-line input; if false, restores these to the default conditions.

The default is true.

void gaia::ui::TextWidget::setTextSize ( float  size)

Set the default text size to the given value, interpreted as "scaled pixel" units.

This size is adjusted based on the current density and user font size preference.

Parameters:
sizeThe scaled pixel size.

void gaia::ui::TextWidget::setTypeface ( const gaia::graphics::Typeface *  tf,
int32_t  style 
)

Sets the typeface and style in which the text should be displayed, and turns on the fake bold and italic bits in the gaia::graphics::Paint if the gaia::graphics::Typeface that you provided does not have all the bits in the style that you specified.

void gaia::ui::TextWidget::setTypeface ( const gaia::graphics::Typeface *  tf)

Sets the typeface and style in which the text should be displayed.

Remarks:
Not all Typeface families actually have bold and italic variants, so you may need to use setTypeface(const gaia::graphics::Typeface*, int32_t) to get the appearance that you actually want.
void gaia::ui::TextWidget::setWidth ( int32_t  pixels)

Makes the TextWidget exactly this many pixels wide.

You could do the same thing by specifying this number in the ControllerParams.
